title.narrative: OPT 2.3. PREVENTION, DETECTION, REPORTING AND REFERENCE OF VIOLENCE IN THE EDUCAT

description.narrative: The education system in the four departments receiving UNICEF support have increased capacity for preventing, detecting, reporting and referring cases of violence, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children and adolescents, especially the most disadvantaged, have increased access to, learning and completion of quality education services, including in emergency situations.

sector.narrative: Ending violence against women and girls

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The education system in the four departments receiving UNICEF support have increased capacity for preventing, detecting, reportingand referring cases of violence

description.narrative: More than 70,000 Pre-primary, primary and secondary level students have benefited from an increased knowledge and improved capacities of their teachers’ to use of new pedagogical and ludic tools.The training helped themdevelop "classroom plans" with content on good treatment, values, empathy, self-care, sexualityandprevention of pregnancy andsexually transmitted infections (STIs). Furthermore, they can now educate students about available healthcare centresandhowtoaccess services.As a result of UNICEF’s support at central level,Bolivia’s education system has a better regulatory framework to help reduce risks and situations of violence toward students in their schools.;; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:22/12/2021

title.narrative: of municipalities with protocols and coordination mechanisms established between the Plurinational Educational System and the child protection services to deal with violence against boys and girls in schools, with support from UNICEF(55760), Text

target.value: 2022:8 municipalities: Cobija, Gonzalo Moreno, Chimore, Puerto Villaroel, Independencia, El Alto, Santa Cruz de la Sierra, Montero

title.narrative: % of schools in chosen school nucleus that implement activities to prevent violence against boys, girls and adolescents in schools, in the municipalities supported by UNICEF(55759), Text

target.value: 2022:100% in 8 municipalities: Cobija, Gonzalo Moreno, Chimore, Puerto Villaroel, Independencia, El Alto, Santa Cruz de la Sierra, Montero
